did.abstract: One letter and one postcard, both dated 1930, written by the writer Ernest St. Clair Bijou.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This small collection is housed in a single folder with no particular arrangement.

bioghist.head: Biographical note
bioghist.p: Ernest St. Clair Bijou was a writer and initiator of the Martha Caldwell Bijou Poetry Prize at Wesleyan.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Ernest St. Clair Bijou correspondence, 1978.033, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Public Library, Center for Brooklyn History.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection was rehoused and the finding aid revised by Dee Bowers in 2023.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A letter written by Ernest St. Clair Bijou to Miss Nancy Ford of Brooklyn Life magazine requesting that the publication review his book of verse, Back Woods Sketches. Bijou refers to himself as "a Brooklyn man." The collection also contains a postcard written by Bijou.
